p: Babesia is transmitted by the deer tick Ixodes scapularis. Infection manifests as fever, anemia, and hepatosplenomegaly. Infected individuals typically have anemia, hemoglobinuria, and hemophagocytosis on bone marrow examination. Treatment is with azithromycin and atovaquone or clindamycin and quinine. In complicated cases exchange transfusions may be required.
